definition: to hang up properly (telephone, picture, clothes etc)

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: Put your towels away, the dishes away, etc. etc.
sentences.chinese: 把你打毛巾掛好，盤子放回廚房，等等等等。

sentences.english: Are pictures and mirrors polished and hanging straight?
sentences.chinese: 掛畫和鏡子是否都掛好和擦乾淨？

sentences.english: The women hung up their coats and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 那幾位女士把外套掛好後就坐了下來。

sentences.english: Hang up screen lock the rear can use.
sentences.chinese: 掛好篩框鎖釦後方可使用。

sentences.english: The clothing is being set up and the dressers are organizing everything.
sentences.chinese: 衣服已經能夠掛好了，服裝師正在做準備。
